main event: A silver-tipped object trailing smoke was observed moving slowly across the sky in Watertown, New York on May 11, 1949, appearing to dissolve from the tail forward.
interesting points: The object was observed by multiple witnesses, including Mrs. Everett Johnson, her small son, and her mother, as reported in The Watertown Daily Times.
The object appeared to move slowly, gaining altitude and then leveling off as it moved northeast, leaving a smoke trail behind.
No unusual aerial activity was recorded on radar by the U.S. Air Force during that time period, and no U.S. Air Force or Royal Canadian Air Force jet aircraft were in the vicinity.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear with a northwest wind at six miles per hour, a temperature of 57 degrees, and a dew point of 28 degrees.
A check with the local flight schedules of commercial, private, and military aircraft flying at the time of the alleged observation proved negative.
witnesses: Multiple witnesses, including Mrs. Everett Johnson, her small son, and her mother
